timeline.body: Judging from how you are using this, please change `devicesRunning` to a Lock and use tryLock instead.
timeline.bodyText: Judging from how you are using this, please change devicesRunning to a Lock and use tryLock instead.
timeline.bodyHTML: Judging from how you are using this, please change devicesRunning to a Lock and use tryLock instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyHTML:
Since you are now allowing the throwing of interrupts, you might as well group the interrupt related exceptions together.

Suggested change
} catch (InterruptedException e) {
} catch (InterruptedException | InterruptedIOException e) {
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body:
`computeIfAbsent` would simplify this a bit.
```suggestion
            this.devices.computeIfAbsent(device.serialNumber, k -> new LinkedBlockingQueue<>()).offer(queueObject);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
computeIfAbsent would simplify this a bit.

Suggested change
if (!this.devices.containsKey(device.serialNumber)) {
this.devices.put(device.serialNumber, new LinkedBlockingQueue<>());
}
this.devices.computeIfAbsent(device.serialNumber, k -> new LinkedBlockingQueue<>()).offer(queueObject);
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: Could this be implemented using CompletableFuture instead?
timeline.bodyText: Could this be implemented using CompletableFuture instead?
timeline.bodyHTML: Could this be implemented using CompletableFuture instead?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Probably. But I would prefer to leave it as-is now as this part has a long history of wrong attempts to fix problems. It would be much easier to review the changes and see if they are really equivalent if there is nothing else in the PR.
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyHTML:
@mgeramb @Trinitus01

Do you think this is correct? I assume that was the intended logic, because message.content.payload is always null at this place.

l. 280/282 creates the message object with Message message = new Message(); which initializes message.content with a content = new Content();. In a newl created Content object the payload is null. message.content.payload is never assigned in the code between the object creation and here.
timeline.author: J-N-K
